lead_paragraph: Voters have strengthened the hand of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, who wants to revise the pacifist Constitution — a prospect likely to add to regional tensions.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jane Perlez from Beijing, Makiko Inoue and Hisako Ueno from Tokyo, and Choe Sang-Hun from Seoul, South Korea.

headline.print_headline: Japan Election, Landslide for Prime Minister, Could Allow a Bolder Military
headline.main: Japan Election, a Landslide for Abe, Could Allow a Bolder Military

snippet: Voters have strengthened the hand of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, who wants to revise the pacifist Constitution — a prospect likely to add to regional tensions....
abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe's ruling coalition wins two-thirds of seats in Parliament, supermajority that could allow Abe to realize his dream of revising Japan's pacifist constitution.
